seq.description: Property.  Standard metadata for higher-level stamped data types.  This is generally used to communicate timestamped data  in a particular coordinate frame.   sequence ID: consecutively increasing ID

stamp.description: Property. Two-integer timestamp that is expressed as:  * stamp.sec: seconds (stamp_secs) since epoch (in Python the variable is called 'secs')  * stamp.nsec: nanoseconds since stamp_secs (in Python the variable is called 'nsecs')  time-handling sugar is provided by the client library

frame_id.description: Property. Frame this data is associated with

height.description: Property.  Header frame_id should be optical frame of camera  origin of frame should be optical center of camera  +x should point to the right in the image  +y should point down in the image  +z should point into to plane of the image  If the frame_id here and the frame_id of the CameraInfo  message associated with the image conflict  the behavior is undefined  image height, that is, number of rows

width.description: Property.  image width, that is, number of columns

encoding.description: Property.  The legal values for encoding are in file src/image_encodings.cpp  If you want to standardize a new string format, join  ros-users@lists.sourceforge.net and send an email proposing a new encoding.  Encoding of pixels -- channel meaning, ordering, size

is_bigendian.description: Property.  taken from the list of strings in include/sensor_msgs/image_encodings.h  is this data bigendian?

step.description: Property.  Full row length in bytes
